issues.description: The return type of messageOnMilk() is declared as boolean in the solution’s Milkable interface and implementations, but the UML diagram and task description specify that messageOnMilk() should return a String containing the milked message. This mismatch prevents students from returning the expected String message and will cause confusion when printing or using the method.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the signature of messageOnMilk() in the Milkable interface to return String, and update the implementations in Seal and Goat to return the message String (e.g., "Seal Clarabelle is milked") instead of printing and returning a boolean.
